ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He raised its vault high and made it level.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and raised its vault high and proportioned it;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He raised its roof and made it proper.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He raised its hei- ght, and has perfected it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He raised high its height, then put it into a right good state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He lifted up its vault, and levelled it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He raised the height thereof and ordered it;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: by raising its vault high and fashioning it flawlessly,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He hath raised the height thereof and perfected it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He raised its vault and fashioned it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: On high hath He raised its canopy, and He hath given it order and perfection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He raised its height, and He has equally ordered it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He raised it high and leveled it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He raised its masses, and proportioned it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:28] He made it rise high — an explication of the manner of [its] construction; in other words, He made its vertical extension high; it is also said that samkahā means ‘its ceiling’ — and levelled it: He made it even, flawless,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: He raised the height) its ceiling (thereof and ordered it) above the earth;
